title.narrative: Enhancing access to affordable medium term to long-term financial services to farmers in greater Mbarara Districts.

description.narrative: Agriterra in partnership with SNV is implementing the value chain component of The Inclusive Dairy Enterprise (TIDE) -2 project in Southwestern Uganda. Through this joint effort Kashongi Farmers savings and credit cooperative was identified to be supported to offer affordable and longer-term finance to dairy farmers among other members in different agricultural value chains. To this end SNV in partnership with Agriterra commissioned a cooperative assessment of Kashongi Farmers SACCO. The Cooperative assessment resulted among others in the following key recommendations: a) Creation of more specific agri-based product portfolio following member needs assessment. b) Offering loans with a longer-term and improved agricultural loan appraisal process. c) Improving exposure of board and management by benchmarking with other SACCOs in dairy value chain financing. d) Sharpening the strategic plan including a marketing and communications strategy. e) Investing in internal capitalization with a clear focus to reduce interest rates and improve member loyalty. f) Training board on financial management with a focus on cash flow projections and interpretation of the financial reports.

Kashongi Farmers SACCO' Big Hairy Audacious Goal (BHAG) is ''To be a sustainable SACCO of choice for agricultural finance in South Western Uganda " Specific goals by 2025: i) Increase membership by 113% from 9 146 to 19 510 ii) Increase share capital by 180% from 1.609 billion to 4.5 billion iii) Increase savings by 380% from 2.248 billion to 10.8 billion iv) Grow the loan portfolio by 439% from 3.821 billion to 20.6 billion v) Grow total assets by 355% from 5.495 billion to 25 billion vi) Increase the size of the loan portfolio by 88% from 40% to 75% vii) Sustainably lower the loan interest rate by 50% from 3% to 1.5 % per month on reducing balance viii) Sustainably increase the maximum loan term by 50% from 2yrs to 3yrs.The above specific goals will be achieved by among others the following interventions;a) Sharpening strategic planb) Tailor-made financial products development/refinement c) Linkage to low-cost loan fund optionsd) Clients relations managemente) Youth councils developmentf) Women leadership development

The project aims at solving difficulties in access to affordable tailor-made finance for investments in the agricultural value chains especially dairy enterprises for rural farmers including women and youth. The interventions will range from sharpening the strategic plan of the SACCO training board management and staff to exposure to similar SACCOs actively funding dairy chains.
